content:
Yes, here are three examples of successful mergers and acquisitions in the hospitality industry:

1. Marriott International and Starwood Hotels & Resorts Worldwide

In 2016, Marriott International completed its acquisition of Starwood Hotels & Resorts Worldwide, creating the largest hotel company in the world. The merger added 30 hotel brands to Marriott's portfolio, including high-end brands like St. Regis and W Hotels. The combined company had over 1.1 million rooms in over 100 countries. The merger also allowed Marriott to expand its loyalty program, which now has over 140 million members. The integration of the two companies went smoothly, with Marriott reporting improved financial results in the years following the merger.

2. AccorHotels and Fairmont Raffles Hotels International (FRHI)

In 2016, AccorHotels acquired FRHI, which owns luxury brands such as Fairmont, Raffles, and Swissôtel. The acquisition gave AccorHotels access to new markets in North America and Asia and expanded its portfolio of luxury hotels. AccorHotels also gained access to FRHI's loyalty program, which has over 6 million members. The integration of the two companies was successful, with AccorHotels reporting strong financial results in the years following the acquisition.

3. InterContinental Hotels Group (IHG) and Kimpton Hotels & Restaurants

In 2015, IHG acquired Kimpton Hotels & Restaurants, a boutique hotel brand with over 60 properties in the United States. The acquisition allowed IHG to tap into the growing demand for boutique hotels and expand its presence in the luxury market. The integration of the two companies was successful, and IHG reported strong financial results in the years following the acquisition. Kimpton also allowed IHG to expand its loyalty program and attract new customers.
